title: How the reworks deal with player feedback
body:
**Darius:**
Static actually discusses the changes with the testers and even goes as far as to try and buff Darius step by step to avoid making him either OP or UP

**Garen**
RiotRepertoir might just be the diamond in the rough amongst those handling these four reworks. He handles player feedback quite well, actually addressing things like garen's E crits and his formerly reduced movement speed while approaching champions.
Not only this but he kept the champion's theme and overall gameplay pattern pretty much the same but improved in healthiness and actual interesting Mechanics.

**Skarner**
Also dealt with by RiotRepertoir. The rework may be a mess but he's really trying to improve upon it by buffing scarier outside of his spires so that he won't be useless outside the jungle. Even though these are baby steps I'm optimistic that Skarner might not get dumpstered by them.


And finally **Mordekaiser**
CertainlyT's basically going al "Lalalalalalala Can't hear you over all the fucks I don't give"
Seriously! When the hell do we even have the PBE and Boards and especially one PBE Mega thread on these changes when he doesn't even bother showing up and actually listening to the testers/the community on what they think about this stuff?


Tl;DR  Riot (CertainlyT in particular) should work on their communication skills and actually listens to Feedback a tad more

> CertainlyT, on the other hand, tell people that if you're getting kited as Morde, you should find a teammate to keep you from getting kited, instead of giving Morde a way to counter kiting.

I think it's possible that the direction of the tone in Morde's PBE thread toward angry or spiteful has started to make it seem like any decision CertainlyT makes on the character doesn't make sense, which is just not the case.

Mordekaiser is a _very_ difficult champion to work on without just changing the entire kit, and that wasn't an option for the character at the time. He has a lot of glaring weaknesses in his kit, including being easily kited. As a player or fan of Morde, it might seem exciting that an update to the champion might attempt to heavily mitigate those weaknesses. However, the design on Morde is an approach of actually embracing those weaknesses _and heavily rewarding the player_ if they manage to overcome them via teamwork and/or clever play. For that to work, it's incredibly important that the reward be there. That said, I can understand it being difficult to see that payoff when it looks like the character is changing so much, and doubts are natural in this case.

Morde is being pushed toward a duo lane/jungle experience because it's fitting for a character with his strength/weakness profile to team up with someone and take on the world together, _not_ for novelty's sake. I've seen the games where Mordekaiser and duo partner are smashing bot lanes and taking dragons, and Morde's third Q hit is chunking people for half their health bar. Though I think there's a lot of shock value to all the changes he's undergoing, the end result should be a pretty fun (albeit different) play experience.

> However, the design on Morde is an approach of actually embracing those weaknesses and heavily rewarding the player if they manage to overcome them via teamwork and/or clever play.

Hold on a fricken second.

Just stop.

Skarner was orignally REWORKED because of this exact issue. He was a Feast or Famine champion easily kited, but if he some how managed to get to you good luck ever getting away.

Riot said this was bad for gameplay and immediately destroyed his identity even though the skarner fanbase had to fight tooth and nail against the original rework.

Why is feast or famine an ok thing now? And if it is, can we get the original Skarner back instead of these rocks?

This is hardly the first time

In Kat's rework years ago, they took out her utility (non-damage) W which buffed her next Q or E and confused basically everyone by saying it was because having to choose a skill to enhance felt bad and instead gave her vastly reduced utility on *every* use and gave her another damage ability

A few months later with Karma's total overhaul, they took away her ability to combo 2 Mantra charges for her 3 abilities by saying what fun gameplay she would have making you pick only one skill to enhance

Then they made champions like Rengar

Believe me, Riot has been schizophrenic for a loooong time

Frankly speaking, I see only twoways this could end: Either it's a failure, and gets pushed out of all lanes by ranged champions, or it's a success and Morde cannot be moved out of bot lane. 

In first case, he's likely going to end up the same as post rework Karma: A failed kit that's only strong in sheer numbers. 
In the secod case, he will inevitably nerfed in his durability (aka shield) as a result of this game's balance philosophy of rewarding offense rather than defense, thus further destroying his identity. 
Also, it's interesting how CertainlyT speaks as if Morde was going to be in a 2 vs 1 lane. He tasks people with finding a support that would allow Morde to catch up, but that'll also mean he needs to be against a support who can't do anything to stop him. Even pre 6 Sona can stop him with Tempo.

This whole argument about "embracing" the weakness of a character is just so counter productive. You know morde players have to deal with being kited, you know they're naturally worse off because of their limited range, yet the rework nerfs both his movement speed and his range on his ult, the only spell that actually was effective against long range on him. Instead of "embracing" his weaknesses, why not make some of his oppressive abilities less oppressive and improve on his kit in other areas? I get that the "juggernauts" are meant to be slow but deadly in meele range, but Skarner, Darius and Garen all have some way to get to their target. Darius has his E, Garen his Q, Skarner his W/E, etc. Instead of giving Morde the means to be effective on his own, you effectively force him into playing a role NO Morde player has EVER wanted to fill. 
And the argument about finding teammates that overcome his weakness of being kited is just ridiculous. Even if you can prevent kiting in the laning phase, you will NEVER find a support that can keep you from getting kited from an ENTIRE TEAM. Not to mention, the other team probably has peel and CC aswell, making the third proc of your Q almost impossible to land. 
I get where you're coming from and what you're planning with the changes, I just think reimagining his role into that of bot lane is just really unrespectful of his playerbase. Why not really "entice" him into a duo lane, instead of taking away one skill simply because you're alone, making your solo lane really underwhelming, whereas it was pretty good before.
